tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Create scaling group
actions.description:
Creates a scaling group.
 Creates a scaling group or a collection of servers
 and load balancers that are managed by a scaling
 policy. To describe the group, specify the scaling
 group configuration, launch configuration, and
 optional scaling policies in the request body in JSON
 format.
 If the request succeeds, the response body describes
 the created group in JSON format. The response
 includes an ID and links for the group.

actions.name: List scaling groups
actions.description:
Lists the scaling groups that are
 available for a specified tenant.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Show scaling group details
actions.description:
Shows configuration details for a
 specified scaling group.
 Details include the launch configuration and the
 scaling policies for the specified scaling group
 configuration.
 The details appear in the response body in JSON
 format.

actions.name: Delete scaling group
actions.description:
Deletes a specified scaling
 group.
 The scaling group must be empty. An empty group
 contains no entities. If deletion is successful, no
 response body is returned. If the group contains
 pending or active entities, deletion fails and a 409
 error message is returned. If there are pending or
 active servers in the scaling group, pass
 force=true to force delete the group.
 Passing force=true immediately deletes
 all active servers in the group. Pending servers are
 deleted when they build and become active.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Show scaling group details including webhooks
actions.description:
Shows configuration details for a
 specified scaling group and its associated webhooks.
 Details include the launch configuration, the
 scaling policies, and the policies' webhooks, for the specified scaling group
 configuration.
 The details appear in the response body in JSON
 format.
 
 
 The ?webhooks=true parameter is required for this method.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Get scaling group state
actions.description:
Gets the current state of a scaling
 group.
 The GroupState object consists of the following
 properties:
 
 paused. Specifies whether execution of
 scaling policies for the group is currently
 suspended. If this value is set to true, the
 group will not scale up or down. All policy
 execution calls will be ignored while this
 value is set to true..
 pendingCapacity. Integer. Specifies
 the number of servers that are in a "building"
 state..
 name. Specifies the name of the
 group.
 Active. Specifies an array of active
 servers in the group. This array includes the
 serverID, as well as other
 data.
 activeCapacity. Integer. Specifies the
 number of active servers in the
 group.
 desiredCapacity. Integer. Specifies
 the sum of all servers that are in
 Active and
 Pending
 state.
 A request to create multiple policies,
 followed by the matching
 response.
 
 Gets the current state of the specified scaling
 group. It describes the state of the group in terms of
 its current set of active entities, the number of
 pending entities, and the desired number of entities.
 The description is returned in the response body in
 JSON format.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Show scaling group configuration
actions.description:
Shows the configuration for a
 scaling group.
 Shows the configuration for a specified scaling
 group, including the maximum and minimum number
 of entities, the global cooldown time, and other metadata. The configuration is
 returned in the response body in JSON format.

actions.name: Update scaling group configuration
actions.description:
Updates the configuration for the
 scaling group.
 Updates the configuration of an existing scaling
 group. To change the configuration, specify the new
 configuration in the request body in JSON format.
 Configuration elements include the minimum number of
 entities, the maximum number of entities, the global
 cooldown time, and other metadata. If the update is
 successful, no response body is returned.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Show launch configuration
actions.description:
Shows launch configuration details
 for a specified scaling group.
 The details include from
 which image to create a server, which load balancers
 to join the server to, which networks to add the
 server to, and other metadata.
 The details appear in the response body in JSON
 format.

actions.name: Update launch configuration
actions.description:
Updates an existing launch
 configuration for the specified scaling group.
 To change the launch configuration, specify the new
 configuration in the request body in JSON format.
 Configuration elements include from which image to create a server, which load
 balancers to join the server to, which networks to add
 the server to, and other metadata. If the update is
 successful, no response body is returned.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Pause group policy execution
actions.description:
Pauses the execution of all scaling
 policies for a specified scaling group.
 IMPORTANT: This method has not been implemented in
 the Auto Scale API yet and will be implemented in a
 future release.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Resume group policy execution
actions.description:
Resumes the execution of all
 scaling policies for a specified scaling group.
 IMPORTANT: This method has not been implemented in
 the Auto Scale API yet and will be implemented in a
 future release.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: List policies
actions.description:
Lists scaling policies that are
 available to a specified scaling group.
 Each policy is described in terms of an ID, name,
 type, adjustment, cooldown time, and links. These
 descriptions are returned in the response body in JSON
 format.

actions.name: Create policy
actions.description:
Creates one or more scaling
 policies for a specified scaling group.
 To create a policy, specify it in the request body
 in JSON format. Each description must include a name,
 type, adjustment, and cooldown time.
 Use the JSON response to obtain information about
 the newly-created policy or policies:
 
 The response header points to the List
 Policies endpoint.
 The response body provides an array of
 scaling policies.
 
 The examples that are provided below show several
 methods for creating a scaling policy:
 A request to create a policy based on
 desired capacity.
 A request to create a policy based on
 incremental change.
 A request to create a policy based on
 change percentage.
 A request to create a policy based on
 change percentage scheduled daily, at a
 specific time of day.
 A request to create a policy based on
 change percentage scheduled once, for a
 specific date and time.
 A request to create multiple policies,
 followed by the matching
 response.

requests.name: Create Policy (Percentage Change at Time) Request: JSON
Create Policy (Percentage Change on Date) Request: JSON
Create Policies Request: JSON

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Delete policy
actions.description:
Deletes a specified scaling policy
 from the specified tenant.
 If deletion is successful, no response body is
 returned.

actions.name: Show policy details
actions.description:
Shows scaling policy
 details.
 Details include an ID, name, type, adjustment,
 cool-down time, and links.
 The details appear in the response body in JSON
 format.

actions.name: Update policy
actions.description:
Updates an existing scaling policy
 for the specified tenant.
 To update the policy, specify the name, type,
 adjustment, and cooldown time for the policy in the
 request body in JSON format. If the change succeeds,
 no response body is returned.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Execute policy
actions.description:
Runs a specified scaling
 policy.
 If the operation succeeds, a response body is
 returned.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: List webhooks for the policy
actions.description:
Lists web hooks and their IDs for a
 specified scaling policy.
 This data is returned in the response body in JSON
 format.

actions.name: Create webhook
actions.description:
Creates one or more webhooks for
 the specified scaling policy.
 Webhooks must have a name. If the operation
 succeeds, the response body contains the IDs and links
 to the newly created web hooks. This data is provided
 in the request body in JSON format.

tenantId.description:
A subscriber to the auto
 scaling service.

actions.name: Show webhook details
actions.description:
Shows webhook details for a
 specified scaling policy.
 The details appear in the response body in JSON
 format.

actions.name: Update webhook
actions.description:
Updates a webhook for a specified
 tenant and scaling policy.If the
 specified webhook is not recognized, the change is
 ignored. If you submit a URL, the URL is ignored but
 that does not invalidate the request. If the change is
 successful, no response body is returned.

actions.name: Delete webhook
actions.description:
Deletes a webhook for a specified
 scaling policy.
 If deletion succeeds, no response body is
 returned.

actions.name: Execute anonymous webhook
actions.description: Runs an anonymous webhook.
